div.p: GRG 19/391, State Records of South Australia, Adelaide.

Wie Sie richtig vermutheten, lieber Herr Holtze, is die geschickte Frucht von Adansonia Gregorii. Ich sah den Baum am Untern Victoria Flusse früchtig im Jahre 1855, u. man kann dort und auch weiter rechts u. links im küstenstrich die Früchte in Menge unter den colossalen Bäumen finden. Jedenfalls würde der Baum einer der schönsten in Ihrem Garten werden im Lauf der Zeit.

div.p:
As you suspected correctly, dear Mr Holtze, the fruit sent is from Adansonia gregorii.
See M to M. Holtze, 19 January 1882. I saw the tree fruiting on the lower Victoria River in the year 1855.
During the North Australian Exploring Expedition, 1855-6. One can find the fruits in big numbers underneath the immense trees there and also further to the right and to the left along the coastal stretch. Anyhow, the tree would become one of the most beautiful in your garden over the years. The fruits will also become bigger. I would advise you to exchange them with all your foreign correspondents! Especially all botanical museums attach importance to such fruits.

If you would like to do me a special favour, I should like to ask you to send me some lichens from there together with fruit, even the smallest that grow on stones. Fungi, mosses in fruit and algae from your area are still altogether unknown.
